title: Classic Green S’chug
ingredients: 4dried red chiles, such as chiles de àrbol
3jalapeño chiles, cored, seeded, and coarsely chopped
¾cup (180 ml) vegetable oil or extra-virgin olive oil
directions: Put the garlic, dried chiles, jalapeños, salt, cumin, cardamom, and oil in a food processor and process to a homogenous but slightly chunky paste. Add the cilantro and pulse a few times until it’s chopped and combined with the rest of the ingredients, but don’t overprocess; you want to retain some texture.
Store in a glass container with a tight-fitting lid in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.
